Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

Mission Introduction - Part 1: Even after her retreat (or "defeat", if Sina was killed during the first Vanguard mission) it is still uncertain what Sina was doing on Leave 6. Was she the scout of a major invasion force or indeed just the opportunistic looter she claimed to be? My guts are telling me that there is something more going on, something shady, as is always the case when there are Syndicate involved. I remember the pictures of the psionic experiments every senior officer had to be briefed on before an assignment within the Borderlands. Just thinking about the horrors depicted there still causes me to shudder.
Spoken by Jack Gelder; added for context

Mission Introduction - Part 2: During our encounter with Sina we managed to obtain one of her star charts. Apparently Sina’s next target was Sorinus Alpha. Yes ... among the millions of planets in this galaxy it had to be Sorinus Alpha, the Union’s shining jewel of science and progress – and witness of my life’s bitterest moments. My personal feelings set aside though, going to Sorinus Alpha will finally shed some light on our situation. If the Star Union is in any kind of trouble we will learn about it there, one way or another.
Spoken by Jack Gelder; added for context

Mission Introduction - Part 3: We are approaching Sorinus Alpha. Since our scanners have been damaged during the trip through the Void, we have to make a blind landing. We don't know what to expect on the surface, but I have told my men to prepare for the worst.
Spoken by Jack Gelder; added for context

Mission Outro - Variant 1 - Sorinus Alpha destroyed via Promethan Doomsday: There lies Sorinus Alpha. What was once a metropolitan world breathing with life has now been reduced to the burnt out carcass of a planet-sized giant. It is a chilling site to see the aftermath of the PyrX inferno, one that I’ll never forget. The only thing making this bearable is the affirmation that an even bigger catastrophe has been prevented today. But we all payed the price.
Spoken by Jack Gelder; added for context

Mission Outro - Variant 2 - Tholian resurrected: While with the resurrection of Emperor Tholian the conflict on Sorinus Alpha may have come to an early end, the battle for the legacy of the Star Union has just been started. It seems that both Tholian and Carminia as well as the different still unmet forces controlling the Syndicate and the Assembly all have their own visions for the future. But in the end it is us, the people whose support they seek, that will decide this conflict with their actions.
Spoken by Jack Gelder; added for context

Mission Outro - Variant 3 - Tholian handed over to CORE: With the extradition of Emperor Tholian his cult and plans to overthrow the old order of CORE have come to an end. But despite this success and my promotion I cannot help wondering if I missed an opportunity when not talking to Tholian first. For I feel like there are still too many puzzle pieces missing to learn what brought the Star Union to its end – and who should be chosen to restore it to its former glory.
Spoken by Jack Gelder; added for context
Name of a location. "Tholian" is male historical emperor
Dust! Ruins! This area looks like a Red Mining Corp ghost town, though much bigger. Wasn’t it our plan to land near Skyrax Nova, Commander?
Story message. Speaker: Male vanguard trooper
This is what’s left of Skyrax Nova, Soldier. Nature has overgrown most of the city. Look at the size of the trees. Whatever tragedy took place here must have happened at least a century ago.
Story message. Speaker: player character (male or female Vanguard, but male by default)
A century ago? Then the Star Union is dead! Everything we knew, gone! My squad mates were right: Leave-6 was only the beginning. The Outlanders will pick us off one by one!
Story message. Speaker: Male vanguard trooper

Calm yourself, Soldier! Let’s find some facts. There are signs of survivors. We should locate the Paragon, like we did on Leave-6. Also, keep your eyes open for Syndicate forces. They may feign good intentions, but their treachery is already well-established.
Story message. Speaker: player character (male or female Vanguard, but male by default) Paragon is an NPC faction Leave-6 is a planet Syndicate is an in-game playable race

171 years ago, I’d assume. This is when the Void Storms cut off all contact to the rest of the Union on Leave-6 and destroyed all ships attempting hyperspace travel. Sorinus Alpha suffered a similar fate. A planet of this size couldn’t possibly support 18 billion people on its own.
Story message. Speaker: Micheal Valentine /Huy Jiang (male Vanguard either way) Sorinus Alpha is a planet

Rather than speculate, let’s find some facts. There are signs of survivors. We should locate the Paragon, like we did on Leave-6. Also, keep your eyes open for Syndicate forces. They may feign good intentions, but their treachery is already well-established.
Story message. Speaker: player character (male or female Vanguard, but male by default) Paragon is an NPC faction Leave-6 is a planet Syndicate is an in-game playable race
Uncover the Fate of the Star Union
Name of a Quest. Star Union is the name of the fallen empire
Check the marked coordinates to search for local Paragon command posts similar to the one on Leave 6.
Hail to the Empire! Tell me, what has happened on Sorinus Alpha?
Have you come here to mock us, {STR_LeaderName}? The Star Union died with the Cataclysm a long time ago. Make yourself useful or get lost!
Story message. Speaker: Paragon Prefect (Male leader of the Paragon)
Salutations, {STR_LeaderName}! Your reputation precedes you: We’ve heard you seek to save what is left of the Union on Sorinus Alpha. How may I help you?

Respectful greetings, Prefect! Your offer is greatly appreciated. We need answers. What happened on this planet? Tell me of Outlander or Syndicate interference. Has there been any contact with Vanguard Central Command?
Story message. Speaker: Paragon Prefect (Male leader of the Paragon)

Of course, for someone returning from a sleeper mission, this whole situation must be horrifying. Almost two centuries ago, Sorinus Alpha was hit by a cosmic shockwave. This eruption from the Void devastated the planet. About one fourth of the population died from the impact alone. Today we call it the Cataclysm.

Any faster-than-light travel and communications were made impossible by the following Void Storms. The destruction and isolation left Sorinus Alpha in ruin. During the chaos, our Kir’Ko slaves rebelled. They founded an independent colony near the Cryo Facility dedicated to Emperor Tholian.

As for Outlanders or Syndicate, other parties arrived shortly before you did, Commander. We don’t know their intentions. They are opportunistic; but, if they are part of any larger invasion, they are not well organized.
Find the Syndicate Forces on Sorinus Alpha - before they find you!
Access the Skyrax Nova Government Hall
Micheal Valentine wants to pay a visit to the Skyrax Nova Government Hall to access the data archives stored there.

And then there is another matter … with Daiyu gone, it is my last duty as a friend, to take the parts of her pet Tappels to a repair facility. It’s the least I can do. Also, I kind of miss the little rascal.
Take the loose components of Tappels and reconstruct the robot pet in your colonies.
It may be actually more work than assembling a new PUG unit, but the effort to repair Tappels will surely be worth it!
Blieeeieeep. Bieliliep. (The robot jumps around enthusiastically. Then it stops, as if fixed on a distant target. Suddenly, it lunges forward.)
Story Message. Speakers: Tappels + third person narration Tappels is a genderless robot dog
Not this time, Tappels! I’m just happy to get you back, don’t run off![br/][br/]Insistent, aren’t you? Alright. Lead the way, boy. This time, let’s go together.
Bieep, blielieeep, biep, bliep! (The robot runs in circles, chasing its own rear antenna.)

Faster Tappels, faster! You can do it! ... Don’t look at me like that. It’s not my fault you always try to catch things out of your reach.[br/][br/]What do you say we give your components a little polish? Daiyu would’ve loved outfitting you with the latest engineering upgrades.
Prepare an inspection and overhaul pack for Tappels in your colonies.
A series of experimental modules to bring Tappels up to modern standards.
Blieeeieeep. Bieliliep. (The robot jumps around enthusiastically. Then it stops, as if fixed on a distant target. Suddenly, it lunges forward.)
Not this time, old boy! No running away for Tappels today.[br/][br/]Insistent, aren’t you? Alright. Fine. Lead the way, boy. I’m happy to see you’re enjoying your new modifications.
I am happy to see you honor the memory of my aunt. Her sudden death was no coincidence. They must have murdered her, like they murdered my father.
Murdered? You said Fang Jiang died in an accident! Also, who is they?

My father had his secrets. Secrets that ended up killing him. My investigations of his death led me to the Outlanders and their Psionics. I joined them but never found his assassins. All I know is that he wasn’t their only victim. The traces of their bloody business spanned the entire empire.
Story Message. Speakers: Huy Jiang (Vanguard male)
Find Givori Ardelli one of House Timur's enemies and evaluate the threat he poses.
There is an incoming transmission, Commander! It appears to be some kind of … bit-code.
Story message. Speaker: Male vanguard trooper
Bit-code? Now that’s rather unusual! Can you make any sense of it, Soldier?
Our communications officer, Ensign Carry, is working on it, Sir! He says he thinks it is an SOS call.
Story message. Speaker: Male vanguard trooper

He thinks so? Under normal circumstances I’d say such speculations are no basis to mount a rescue mission, but clearly none of this here are normal circumstances.[br/][br/]Very well, Soldier, tell Ensign Carry we will check out his ‘emergency’.
Go to the location the supposed distress call originated from and find out what is going on there.
Krlk tskrrt grglkshh xwrkk. (The alien creates a series of clicking noises with its mandibles.)
Story message. Speaker: Zrey Rag'Sal (Female Kir'Ko broodmother)
We have important news regarding the earlier transmission, Commander! Ensign Carry found out the message was no bit-code after all, but the audio recording of a …
Story message. Speaker: Male vanguard trooper

… Kir’Ko. Yes, we figured out that part ourselves by now. Ask Ensign Carry how many of his Academy classes on extra-human languages he missed. He will have to brush up on his Kir’Ko if we want to talk to our new friend.

Worry not, Colonel. I can communicate with you directly through your thoughts. My species acquired this ability while … ‘serving’ humans, though not many of us will use it so openly to contact one of your kind.
Story message. Speaker: Zrey Rag'Sal (Female Kir'Ko broodmother)

My name is Zrey Rag’Sal, third Broodmother of the Kir’Ko Ktalla. I am grateful for your assistance. Our colony suffers. The Syndicate attacks us. I was taken prisoner. Their minds are noisy. They seek to enslave us all. Some of my brethren are held in transport convoys not far from this location. Will you help me to set them free again?
Story message. Speaker: Zrey Rag'Sal (Female Kir'Ko broodmother) Kir'Ko Ktalla is a Kir'Ko tribe

I’ll be frank, Zrey Rag’Sal: I don’t like my mind being invaded by psionic tricks. I admit, seeing the Kir’ko free is unsettling, but we have a common enemy.[br/][br/]I will help you – for now. Be aware that I’ll be watching all of your movements. That is at least until I know more about this so called Kir’Ko colony you’ve been talking about.
We cannot assist the Kir’ko. Not while the fate of the Star Union is at stake.

Your bug-friends are of no importance to us. The real question here is how there can exist a Kir’Ko colony on Sorinus Alpha at all. When did you rise up against the Star Union? Maybe you and your people are the real reason why the Empire fell! I will have to detain you for interrogation.
Zrey Rag'Sal told you the Syndicate have started reenslaving the Kir'Ko from her colony. She knows the route of two more such slaver convoys. Defeat the guards to free her brethren.
No one shall shackle our people again! The Kir'Ko Ktalla give you their gratitude.
Get hold of Zrey Rag'Sal to capture and interrogate her.
I would rather die than fall into the hands of a human again!
Story message. Speaker: Zrey Rag'Sal (Female Kir'Ko broodmother)
A host of Kir'Ko has appeared to take revenge on the death of Zrey Rag'Sal. Survive their attack!
Tappels has noticed something. To find out what it was you need to follow him.
Tappels search continues. Follow him and find out where he will lead you.
Bielieep. Blielieliep blieeep. (The robot keeps its head to the ground walking on a straight course. It stops, then turns. It runs in a new direction with increased speed.)
Sorry, Commander. I’m just as alive as you are. My … death was a necessary precaution. Unfortunately, it would’ve been far less convincing if you knew it was faked.
Story Message. Speakers: Daiyu Jiang (Female Vanguard)

Convincing? I’ll tell you how the hell convincing it was! I mourned for you, Daiyu! I mourned a person I trusted - I regarded as a friend! Now, I find you still alive, casually talking about your staged death. Sadly, my friend Daiyu may still be lost forever.

Faking your own death is a necessary skill when you’re hunted by the Fifth Order. It has always been one of my specialties, though I am sorry I deceived you. My poor brother’s death on the other hand was genuine. I knew that if they got to him, my cover was blown as well. I had to act with great caution, if I still wanted to complete my mission.
Story Message. Speakers: Daiyu Jiang (Female Vanguard)
The Fifth Order? Your mission? What the hell are you talking about?

I guess it is time you learned the truth. Do you still keep that toy corvette model? In it, I hid a data chip detailing an encryption protocol you’ll need. Research and upgrade your communicators to create a secure channel. Once completed, contact me. And thanks for taking such good care of Tappels, Commander. I should have known he would sense that I needed help. Somehow he always does.
Story Message. Speakers: Daiyu Jiang (Female Vanguard)

I guess it is time you learned the truth. Do you still keep that toy corvette model? In it, I hid a data chip detailing an encryption protocol you’ll need. Research and upgrade your communicators to create a secure channel. Once completed, contact me.
Story Message. Speakers: Daiyu Jiang (Female Vanguard)
Apply the encryption algorythm Daiyu Jiang send you to contact her on a secure channel.
An encryption algorithm developed by the New Horizon. Used for secure communications.
So … here we are. I am listening, Daiyu - if that is even your real name.

Thank you for coming, Commander. My name is of little importance. What matter is that about 350 years ago, my brother and I joined a clandestine group called the New Horizon. We sought to liberate the Star Union and humanity from the restrictive control of CORE. Emperor Tholian was our leader.
Story Message. Speakers: Daiyu Jiang (Female Vanguard) CORE is an omnipotent planetary genderless AI

After Tholian’s Merging, his successor Carminia was inaugurated and a group of assassins was sent to kill us. This Fifth Order knew all about us. Within weeks, most of New Horizon was wiped out. Those of us that survived went into hiding, plotting the resurrection of Emperor Tholian.
Story Message. Speakers: Daiyu Jiang (Female Vanguard)

Tappels was my only connection to Tholian. The Emperor left his PUG to us, tasking it to collect the memory chips needed for his resurrection from cryo-sleep. I had no idea that Tappels would only find them after 200 years in a cryo-pod myself. It’s why he ran off when we landed on Leave-6.
Story Message. Speakers: Daiyu Jiang (Female Vanguard)

Once I discovered my brother was dead, I had to get to Sorinus Alpha. Unfortunately, the Fifth Order arrived here first. I’ve met Givori Ardelli before. He knows what I am carrying and is determined to stop me.
Story Message. Speakers: Daiyu Jiang (Female Vanguard)

This is where you come into play, Commander. Take Tholian’s memory chips to his cryotomb and restore his mind and body. I will distract Givori Ardelli, while he still thinks that I am his primary target. Please, Sir, will you help me?
Story Message. Speakers: Daiyu Jiang (Female Vanguard)

Six years ago, I thought you were too young to join the Vanguard. How old were you back then: 170? 180? Bloody Paragon and their life-prolonging augments![br/][br/]Blast the Fifth Order, CORE and Frozen Emperors! All I know is that in all the years you’ve served with me, there’s never been a mission I couldn’t rely on you. It is time to return the favor.

Thank you, Commander! Technically, it was 203 years ago that we first met. Time dilatation takes some getting used to...[br/][br/]One more thing: Tholian’s cryotomb is guarded by a Kir’Ko named Chin Til’Trz, descendant of Tsu Til’Ix, another member of the New Horizon. He’s sworn to protect the frozen Emperor. You must earn his trust before he allows you near Tholian.
Story Message. Speakers: Daiyu Jiang (Female Vanguard)
A Kir’Ko? I am beginning to understand now what you meant by reforming the Star Union.[br/][br/]Alright, I’ll try to negotiate with him. If everything else fails, I force my way in.
You promised me explanations Daiyu, but all you give me are wild stories about conspiracies, secret organizations and frozen emperors.

Even if I believed you, why should I support the goals of a strange cult dedicated to a long-dead emperor? To oppose CORE, which brought stability and prosperity to the Star Union and put an end to the violent intrigues and feuds of Star Holders and Senators? I don’t think so. Look at the destruction around us, Daiyu. This is what comes of liberating the Union from CORE.

I am sorry to hear you feel this way, Commander. I see now that it was a mistake to let you in on all this. This transmission has come to an end. I wish you good luck with your efforts here. You are going to need it.
Story Message. Speakers: Daiyu Jiang (Female Vanguard)
There are two ways for you to access the Cryo Facility where Emperor Tholian rests: You can forcefully take the facility or prove to its protector Chin Til'Trz your allegiance with the New Horizon.

I guess this is it. We have the memory chips and the access to Tholian’s cryo-pod. Now all we need to do is insert the chips and reactivate the awakening sequence…[br/][br/]As I recall, the last Emperor awakened from cryo-sleep murdered half the welcoming committee and eventually died in a madhouse. Let’s just hope Daiyu knows better.
Return the memory chips Daiyu gave you to the cryo-pod of Emperor Tholian and activate its reawakening protocol.
An experimental method of memory chip reintegration during the cryo-sleep wake-up phase.
I am ... alive, my memories intact. The Merging … circumvented. Against the universe, against all odds, against CORE, my plan worked! All forecasts and equations predicted I was doomed!

Forgive me, Colonel, for spoiling the moment. I’m afraid, I was never too fond of all the imperial rites and ceremonies. I don’t think that I have met you before – who is the Vanguard officer that brought my cryogenic slumber to an end?

Don’t worry about me minding the lack of courtesy, your Highness. Not too long ago I crawled out of a freezing pod myself. My name is {STR_LeaderName} and I left on a sleeper mission two centuries ago.

When I returned, the Star Union had collapsed and I was left to find out that my friend Daiyu and her pet Tappels were not who they seemed. I pray the hopes they put in your return were justified – this new world is in dire need of good leadership.

So the Cataclysm occurred… I wasn’t sure Carminia had it in her. She still seemed like a child back then, though she did have that spark I only ever saw in someone with the Rho-Sequence. It is quite ironic that despite all our scientific knowledge and technology we still had to rely on a rare genetic mutation to choose our Emperors, wouldn’t you agree?

Though I am wandering off topic. You are right, Colonel, when you say it is time I repay the trust and loyalty demonstrated by my followers and friends. But first we all need to talk. There is much I need to learn.

This is {MSTR_ASSEMBLY_SYNTHESIS_LEADER_NAME} of the Assembly. We are currently processing Sorinus Alpha, progress reports still pending. I advise all present subjects to remain calm while waiting for Reassembly. And remember: body parts may be replaceable, but they are still valuable resources – don’t waste them too carelessly.
Story message. Speaker: Zetrodicus Stein (Male Assembly)

…[br/][br/]What the hell was that all about? These things look even worse than the Paragon in their current pitiful state! Though I have the bad feeling we are going to find out about this ‘Reassembly’ business of theirs soon enough…

Good day, Colonel. It is a welcome change to meet a Vanguard that is still wearing his uniform with pride. Most of your fellow officers are so shell-shocked about the collapse of their precious Star Union that bending their spirit has become a task easy enough for any first year Initiate.
Story message. Speaker: Givori Ardelli (Male Syndicate)
You on the other hand, Colonel, you’ve just arrived from a time when the word of a Vanguard was the law. So fresh, full of energy. Corrupting your high principles will be a delightful challenge!
Story message. Speaker: Givori Ardelli (Male Syndicate)

I am not interested in the perverted pleasures you draw from your crimes, Syndicate! State your business or keep your mouth shut while we settle this the old-fashioned way.[br/][br/]You will have plenty of time to talk once you are in an imperial prison cell.
You see, Colonel, that’s precisely what I meant! All that passionate righteousness you spout is just marvelous! You and I are going to have so much fun together.
Story message. Speaker: Givori Ardelli (Male Syndicate)

Givori Ardelli. That name sounds familiar. He was dismissed in disgrace when the Union shut-down the Psynumbra project. The Psynumbra represents the worst inclinations a mind can conceive. As a trainee, I knew victims of their ruthless experiments. Pale and agonized, those poor souls kept babbling nonsensical gibberish about demonic hallucinations.
If it isn’t my most favorite Vanguard officer! Welcome, Darling, how thoughtful of you to personally come here and help me out in this most unpleasant situation!
Story message. Speaker: Sina of House Timur (Female Syndicate)

You can drop the charade, Sina. If I followed you here it was by no means to provide you with any help, but to keep a close eye on your shady dealings. I don’t care if you’re in trouble. In fact, whatever pitiful misfortune has befallen you, I am sure you deserve it.
I am surprised by your rude tone, Colonel. You struck me as one of good manners. Now you almost make it sound as if you don’t like me!
Story message. Speaker: Sina of House Timur (Female Syndicate)
Not like you? Now there’s some sense of humor! I don’t just don’t like you, Sina. I despise you![br/][br/]And I refuse to believe that surprises you after what happened on Leave-6.

Not like you? Now there’s some sense of humor! I don’t just don’t like you, Sina. I despise you![br/][br/]And I refuse to believe that surprises you after what happened on Leave-6. As I recall it your last words to me were that I had ‘made myself a powerful enemy’.

We’ve had our differences in the past. But we are on the same side, Colonel. Take a look around. You’ll find that Givori Ardelli and that insubordinate Kir’Ko are the real threat, not to mention those crazy machine people. I was contracted by forces seeking to reestablish the old order. As a Vanguard who just returned from a sleeper mission, I expected you to sympathize.
Story message. Speaker: Sina of House Timur (Female Syndicate)
Not sure what to believe, but next to Givori Ardelli, you may be the lesser evil. That alone hardly turns you into a trustworthy person. I’ll ponder your advice. We shall speak again soon.
Not sure who to believe, but I will take a look at this Givori Ardelli.

By losing Huy Jiang we have lost a good man. He may have made his mistakes in the past when colaborating with the Outlanders. But he did so to investigate his father's death and I cannot judge him for that.

It is life's cruel irony that now that we had settled our past differences, O'Connor had to fall in battle. Before my sleeper mission I wouldn't have cared, but now I see in this the death of a fine Vanguard officer - one of the last from my time and generation.

Oh no, old boy! This wasn't part of the deal, you know? Falling apart on me like that! That's not okay, not okay at all![br/][br/]And what is Daiyu going to say when I have to tell her? She will be completely crestfallen.

Oh no, old boy! This wasn't part of the deal, you know? Falling apart on me like that! That's not okay, not okay at all![br/][br/]I wonder what Daiyu would have said if she saw you all broken-down like this. She would have been completely crestfallen.
You! How dare of you to cross the path of House Timur again after what happened on Leave 6. You have killed my sister and you are going to pay for it!
Story message. Speaker: Taron of House Timur (Male Syndicate)
Sina only got what she deserved. Attack me or my men and I will see to it that the two of you will be reunited after all.

Greetings, human! We hope you greet the Kir'Ko in peace. Respect our territory and we will make prolific relations. The Kir'Ko Ktalla have enemies on all sides. Our breeding grounds are in great danger. We need to shield our eggs. Anti-bio weapons are used against us. We have no experience processing non-organic materials. Will you help us protect our offspring?
Story message. Speaker: Chin Til'Drz (Male Kir'Ko)
I know the cruelty of the Syndicate. If we show you our good faith and help your people to protect against them, maybe the Kir'Ko will later help us driving the Syndicate off the planet.
We have our own borders to protect, Kir'Ko. While we have our hands full with the Syndicate, we have no time to worry about some smashed eggs.

Greetings, Colonel! Are you the human we heard about that is a friend to the Kir'Ko? The Kir'Ko Ktalla are swarmed by enemies on all sides. Our breeding grounds are threatened. We need to shield our eggs. Anti-bio weapons are used against us. We have no experience processing non-organic materials. Help us protect our offspring.
Story message. Speaker: Chin Til'Drz (Male Kir'Ko)

When I first met Zrey Rag'Sal, I was sceptical about the liberated Kir'Ko. Now I see that you are not our enemies. The treatment of your kind may have been the biggest mistake in the history of the Star Union. Maybe this is the day that we can start working together to heal the scars of the past.
Stay away, human! We are well aware of the crimes you committed against our sister! Come close to our borders and you shall experience the wrath of the Kir'Ko Ktalla.
Story message. Speaker: Chin Til'Drz (Male Kir'Ko)
Is this supposed to be a threat, Kir'Ko? I don't negotiate with bugs. I swat them.

The Kir'Ko Ktalla need to protect their breeding grounds against the attacks of their enemies. They hope more conventional armor will better resist the specialized anti-biological weapons that is being used against them.
With a casing like that, the eggs of the Kir'Ko should be well-protected.

Protected by these new metal shells you provided, the next hatch of the Kir'Ko Ktalla will see the light of the day. You have our thanks, {STR_LeaderName}. Our wise Dream Reader Hatyl Ur'Uk once said: 'The future of the Kir'Ko lies in the cooperation with their former oppressors. Both species must learn much from the other.'
Story message. Speaker: Chin Til'Drz (Male Kir'Ko)
If Givori Ardelli has established a Psynumbra presence on Sorinus Alpha he must have installed a dedicated base, where the infamous Psynumbra rituals take place. Find it!
This is where the followers of Givori Ardelli conduct their rituals. We must proceed into the compound with caution. There is no way of telling what psionic nightmares await us therein.
Kill the cultists guarding the Dark Sanctorum.
Ah, Colonel, welcome to our humble establishment! Take a good look around, what you can see here is the future of mankind – a future that could also be yours for the taking.
Story message. Speaker: Givori Ardelli (Male Syndicate)
The only things I have seen since I entered here are agony and suffering. We‘ve already had more than enough of that throughout our history. Thanks, I think I’ll pass…

Don’t be a fool, Colonel. I am talking about true power. People that have the courage can use that power for the greater good. It’s why you joined the Vanguard, {STR_LeaderName}! Doing right requires drastic action. Look past your preconceptions. The Psynumbra offer you the means to reach true greatness.
Story message. Speaker: Givori Ardelli (Male Syndicate)

Or in other words all I need to do is rid myself of my humanity! Your recruitment speech is over, Ardelli. I’ll incinerate this planet before I let it fall into the hands of a self-deluded monster like you!
So, Darling… have you made up your mind?
Story message. Speaker: Sina of House Timur (Female Syndicate)
Let's pretend I was about to believe it was in my interest to help you. What is it that you want?

Splendid, Darling. I knew I could count on you. You see my contractor is interested in learning the truth about the Cataclysm. I was hired to retrieve the research of Thomas Lianhouse, who was a scientist specialized on the Void and its connection to the physical world.
Story message. Speaker: Sina of House Timur (Female Syndicate)
And then there is another rather specific item … I need to retrieve the cryo-pod of Emperor Tholian.
Story message. Speaker: Sina of House Timur (Female Syndicate)

Now that is a very specific request. Somebody is interested in Tholian's past. I am surprised you don't know Tholian and Thomas Lianhouse were the same person. Times really have changed since my sleeper mission.
Enter the Cryo Facility dedicated to Emperor Tholian and retrieve the cryo-pod of the frozen emperor.
Gather any remaining data related to the research of Thomas Lianhouse from the Dimensional Rift Complexes on Sorinus Alpha.

Interesting … by the looks of it Tholian was investigating the effects of the Void on the human mind. He analyzed brainwave readings from test subjects exposed to long distance Void travel. If only I could interpret his notes…

I cannot believe it! If I understand these figures correctly, Tholian was trying to prove that a person caught in the explosion of a gravity bomb, precisely where the Void and physical world intersected, could alter the nature of said person on a sub-atomic level…

Using G-bombs to manipulate life… It doesn’t take a genius to figure out this dangerous kind of theory could go wrong in the wrong hands very fast. No wonder so many people are suddenly interested in Tholian and his research.

Impressive work, Colonel. You could make a fine agent of House Timur one day... Compile the data and send it together with the other asset to me, so we can finalize this business. It is possible that my contractor will want to talk to you directly then. He knows about your contributions to the success of this mission.
Story message. Speaker: Sina of House Timur (Female Syndicate)
Deliver the cryo-pod and research to Sina, after compiling the data you collected earlier.
Analyze the Data collected in the Voidtech Research Centers.

Marvelous, we have received the items. Always a pleasure doing business with you, Darling! Take care, I am sure we will see each other again…[br/][br/]Oh and certainly, there is somebody here who wants to talk to you.
Story message. Speaker: Sina of House Timur (Female Syndicate)
COLONEL. YOUR SERVICES TO THE EMPIRE HAVE BEEN OBSERVED AND EVALUATED. YOU ARE AWARDED A NEW RANK OF UNION GENERAL. MILITARY AUTHORIZATION LEVEL WHITE ALPHA. EFFECT: IMMEDIATELY.
Story message. Speaker: CORE (omnipotent planetary genderless AI)
I accept my new title and duties with great honor. Hail to the Empire and hail to CORE![br/][br/]Is it allowed to ask what will happen to Emperor Tholian?

DISCHARGED EMPEROR THOLIAN WILL BE PROCESSED ACCORDING TO PROTOCOL. FURTHER ASSISTANCE WON’T BE REQUIRED. HOWEVER THERE IS ANOTHER THREAT THAT STILL MUST BE DEALT WITH. YOU WILL RECEIVE NEW INSTRUCTIONS SOON.
Story message. Speaker: CORE (omnipotent planetary genderless AI)
Every Vanguard going on a sleeper mission has their own reasons to do so. But not always a century-long journey allows you to escape the ghosts of your past…

As much as I hate to look back at what happened the last time I was on Sorinus Alpha, now that I am here I cannot just ignore the past. I did not think I would ever want to return there, but it would feel wrong not to pay the Parlington Campus a visit. It seems like the right way to properly honor the memory of...
It is time to face your past! Head to the old campus of the Parlington University.
To go through these gates again, walk the same corridors, see the same old science posters on the walls... makes it seem like yesterday that I last visited Ellen this way.

Not that she ever noticed, busy as she was with her experiments, always leaning over the schematics of some robot or one of those infernal cybernetic implants that gave me the creeps. I guess it should have been obvious to us things would end the way they did sooner or later.

Don’t be so melancholic, {STR_LeaderFirstName}. I liked it better when you were still a carefree boy. Or rather she did. Not that this distinction is still of importance now that we have integrated the replication of memory chips into our cloning processes…

Don’t be so melancholic, {STR_LeaderFirstName}. I liked it better when you were still a carefree girl. Or rather she did. Not that this distinction is still of importance now that we have integrated the replication of memory chips into our cloning processes…
Story message. Speaker: Ellen Shaw (Assembly female)

Ellen? … Noooo! What have they done to you?[br/][br/]Though wait … this was your own choice, wasn’t it? Replacing your body parts with enhanced robot pieces until there was nothing human left. Is this where your research took you in the end?

You always need to exaggerate, don’t you, {STR_LeaderFirstName}? As usual your assessment is only partially correct. Though I can’t blame you this time: The Assembly’s existence isn’t easy to grasp. But there is a simple way to show you. Embrace me, it won’t hurt for long…
Story message. Speaker: Ellen Shaw (Assembly female)
Stop the Assembly you found at the Parlington University.

Ellen … Why? Why did this have to happen? I put you out of your misery, but the price … the price is too high. The only consolation I have left now is knowing that I did the right thing. This Assembly you had become, it wasn’t you… and yet it was.

Based on what we learned about these Assembly so far, they seem to put together different body and machine parts when they create their twisted form of life. If that is true there could still be a way for me to save Ellen.

Yes … if I can learn more about the Assembly’s methods and find the clones she was talking about, then maybe I will be able to imbue her with life again. And this time I’ll make sure she remembers me the way she was supposed to!
Find and kill Assembly units to salvage their corpses for future analysis.
Stop wasting your time, {STR_LeaderFirstName}! The Ellen Shaw you knew is gone. The only way to reunite with her is within the reassembled society of the Assembly!
Story message. Speaker: Ellen Shaw (Assembly female)
Kill the second clone of Ellen Shaw to collect body parts for Ellen's resurrection.

How often will I still have to kill you, Ellen, to make you alive again?[br/][br/]We need to analyze those Assembly we sampled. There has to be a way to understand the way they are patching together their bodies.
Start an analysis of the different collected Assembly parts to gain a better understanding of their physiognomy

If only you ever had shown such passionate interest in Ellen’s experiments. But do not worry, you are already embracing the essence of your future Assembly existence. Destruction is only the first step of creation and death the roadway to rebirth.
Story message. Speaker: Eileen Shaw (Assembly female, clone of Ellen)
Kill the third clone of Ellen Shaw to collect body parts for Ellen's resurrection.

With all the parts from her clones and our data from the collected Assembly bodies we should be able to start Ellen’s resurrection. None of my men could be allowed to know the true reason of our investigations, so I divided the operation into sub-tasks, with each medical team working on a different part of Ellen’s new body.
Use your knowledge of the Assembly surgery and the body parts from Ellen Shaw's clones and the other Assembly to resurrect Ellen Shaw.
You have the knowledge and the materials. Now it is time to do some stitching together!
This is it. The moment of truth has arrived. Let’s see if the operation was successful…
No! How could this happen? Ellen … forgive me.
To go through these gates again, walk the same corridors, see the same old science posters on the walls... makes it seem like yesterday that I last visited Simon this way.

Not that he ever noticed, busy as he was with his experiments, always leaning over the schematics of some robot or one of those infernal cybernetic implants that gave me the creeps. I guess it should have been obvious to us things would end the way they did sooner or later.

Don’t be so melancholic, {STR_LeaderFirstName}. I liked it better when you were still a carefree boy. Or rather he did. Not that this distinction is still of importance now that we have integrated the replication of memory chips into our cloning processes…

Don’t be so melancholic, {STR_LeaderFirstName}. I liked it better when you were still a carefree girl. Or rather he did. Not that this distinction is still of importance now that we have integrated the replication of memory chips into our cloning processes…
Story message. Speaker: Simon Torren (Assembly Male)

Simon? … Noooo! What have they done to you?[br/][br/]Though wait … this was your own choice, wasn’t it? Replacing your body parts with enhanced robot pieces until there was nothing human left. Is this where your research took you in the end?

You always need to exaggerate, don’t you, {STR_LeaderFirstName}? As usual your assessment is only partially correct. Though I can’t blame you this time: The Assembly’s existence isn’t easy to grasp. But there is a simple way to show you. Embrace me, it won’t hurt for long …
Story message. Speaker: Simon Torren (Assembly Male)
Stop the Assembly you found at the Parlington University.

Simon … Why? Why did this have to happen? I put you out of your misery, but the price … the price is too high. The only consolation I have left now is knowing that I did the right thing. This Assembly you had become, it wasn’t you… and yet it was.

Based on what we learned about these Assembly so far, they seem to put together different body and machine parts when they create their twisted form of life. If that is true there could still be a way for me to save Simon.

Yes … if I can learn more about the Assembly’s methods and find the clones he was talking about, then maybe I will be able to imbue him with life again. And this time I’ll make sure he remembers me the way he was supposed to!
Find and kill Assembly units to salvage their corpses for future analysis.
Stop wasting your time, {STR_LeaderFirstName}! The Simon Torren you knew is gone. The only way to reunite with him is within the reassembled society of the Assembly!
Kill the second clone of Simon Torren to collect body parts for Simon's resurrection.

How often will I still have to kill you, Simon, to make you alive again?[br/][br/]We need to analyze those Assembly we sampled. There has to be a way to understand the way they are patching together their bodies.
Start an analysis of the different collected Assembly parts to gain a better understanding of their physiognomy

If only you ever had shown such passionate interest in Simon’s experiments. But do not worry, you are already embracing the essence of your future Assembly existence. Destruction is only the first step of creation and death the roadway to rebirth.
Story message. Speaker: Sylvius Torren (Assembly Male, clone of Simon)
Kill the third clone of Simon Torren to collect body parts for Simon's resurrection.

With all the parts from his clones and our data from the collected Assembly bodies we should be able to start Simon’s resurrection. None of my men could be allowed to know the true reason of our investigations, so I divided the operation into sub-tasks, with each medical team working on a different part of Simon’s new body.
Use your knowledge of the Assembly surgery and the body parts from Simon Torren's clones and the other Assembly to resurrect Simon Torren.
You have the knowledge and the materials. Now it is time to do some stitching together!
This is it. The moment of truth has arrived. Let’s see if the operation was successful…
No! How could this happen? Simon … forgive me.

To go through these gates again, walk the same corridors, see the same old science posters on the walls... and to think that they kept Alfie in such an environment after taking him away from me. They said they needed to do some tests on him, said he was no ordinary cat. What a ridiculous excuse to kidnap my Alfie! Cats are cats!

Then they took him here, locked him away, and despite my protests I was never allowed to visit. Poor Alfie! Once they had tortured you to death with their experiments, they didn’t even have the integrity to admit their cruel deeds. Devoured by a penguin! Ha! That must have been the most pathetic attempt to cover a pet-murder in the entire history of pet-murders. A penguin!
What was that…? Did I just hear -? What the hell is going on here?!
Find the Source of the Noise
Was it a voice or was it an animal? Find out what was causing the noise on the Parlington University campus.
Ehh, ehhhhh! A short slumber on a stretcher… you will only feel a slight sting. Ehhh, gawek!
Damn it! We’ve followed the wrong track. It is escaping towards the coast!
Catch up with the unknown creature before it escapes.
Hooonk, eh ehh! First the skin, then the liver. Cat hair always good dressing. Ehh, ehh eh!

So now it submerged deeper into the water, great. Looks like we’ve lost it![br/][br/]Though wait … our underwater scanners are detecting a life form approaching our position again. But good lord, this one is enormous!
Your presence has attracted an enormous underwater creature. Deal with it!
Gawek, ehh! They probed us, connected us to their machines, analyzed our brainwaves and cut us open. But they still couldn’t figure out that they were the actual experiment. Hooonk!
The strange creature has escaped you a second time. You need to track it down again!
Coming here was a mistake, {STR_LeaderFirstName}, ehh ehhh! You know too much. Now we play the eating game! Gawek, gawek!
Survive the onslaught of the penguins.

Poor Alfie! Finding your collar in the insides of this creature. After all that time. I cannot believe that at least that part of their story was true. This whole bizarre encounter makes me wonder though: Alfie, were you really just a cat?
Fear not, {STR_LeaderName} … listen to my voice … hear my warning: Sorinus Alpha is in great danger. Buried in its ruins lies the fate of the Union…
Who are you? Why are you invading my mind? Identify yourself!
…[br/][br/]The whispers are gone. My thoughts are my own again. Bloody Psionics! With that kind of cryptic advice I guess I can only wait and see if I get ‘contacted’ again.

The shifting tides of the Void only allow for short moments of clarity … I sense you already met some of the groups invading Sorinus Alpha. Be careful, they must not be allowed to find what they seek…
But what are they looking for? How am I supposed to keep them from finding something I don’t know about?[br/][br/]And there. The voice is gone…

The secret must not be revealed. The risk is too high … its knowledge … another Cataclysm… Trust my words, {STR_LeaderName}. During the Parade on Radelus Prime you may have shyly looked away when my procession passed you, but there is no reason to be afraid of your Empress. Let me guide you.

Empress Carminia? … Your Highness … This is impossible! How can you possibly remember me? I was a little child. There were thousands of spectators that day. I never even considered it possible that you noticed … But I wasn’t afraid that moment … it was just, that I …
I know. Do not worry, your little secret has always been safe with me. But now you need to listen… Sorinus Alpha… it has to be … …
Story message. Speaker: Empress Carminia (Female human empress who started the Cataclysm)

…[br/][br/]I cannot believe it. Empress Carminia is still alive … and talking to me in my thoughts! Am I losing my mind? Could this be some psionic trick or dream world? No! It all felt too real. Only Empress Carminia could know…

{STR_LeaderName} … time is running short. You must destroy Sorinus Alpha. It is the only way to assure no one will ever gain hold of the knowledge again that led to the Cataclysm![br/][br/]You have the means, {STR_LeaderName}. Research the Planetary Purification Protocol… the sacrifice of one world ... to save millions…
Story message. Speaker: Empress Carminia (Female human empress who started the Cataclysm)

…[br/][br/]Start Planetary Purification? Incinerate an entire planet with its population? Only madmen consider such things. The Prometheans have resorted to such drastic actions in the past, but they were always the villains. Things look different once you’re the one asked to pull the trigger.

If I carry out Carminia’s orders, I have two options: I can directly research and employ this Doomsday Weapon – or I can secure the planet through military means. With all opposition subdued, I’ll have no trouble initiating Planetary Purification.
{STR_LeaderName}, it is time. Do not falter or look back with remorse. It is your destiny…
Story message. Speaker: Empress Carminia (Female human empress who started the Cataclysm)

A last quiet before the storm. One slow breathing in, one fingertip pushing a button. And then a new sun is ignited and nothing will be as it was.[br/][br/]May the gods of this universe have mercy on my soul.
Extract the Cryopod of Emperor Tholian.
Download any data connected to the research of Thomas Lianhouse.
Victory Condition: Assess the Syndicate Threat
You can end this mission by gathering information about the Syndicate forces on the planet and deal with them accordingly.[br/][br/]Syndicate Forces Found: {INT_0}/{INT_1}

Sorinus Alpha is being overrun by a variety of different threats. To regain control of the planet extreme measures may be required. Win the map through one of the standard victory conditions.[br/][br/][firecol](Warning: Choosing this victory path will have consequences in later missions!)[/firecol][br/][br/]Domination Victory: {INT_0}/{INT_1}[br/]Conquest Victory: {INT_2}/{INT_3}[br/]Doomsday Victory: {INT_4}/{INT_5}

To protect the knowledge buried on Sorinus Alpha, Empress Carminia has asked you to destroy the planet. You can either do so by directly achieving a Doomsday Victory or by securing it through a military victory and setting up your Doomsday Weapon afterwards.[br/][br/][firecol](Warning: Choosing this victory path will have consequences in later missions!)[/firecol][br/][br/]Domination Victory: {INT_0}/{INT_1}[br/]Conquest Victory: {INT_2}/{INT_3}[br/]Doomsday Victory: {INT_4}/{INT_5}

Sina of House Timur claims to be working for the forces that try to reestablish the old order of the Star Union. Listen to her arguments and make a choice: Do you want to help her with her mission on Sorinus Alpha?[br/][br/][firecol](Warning: Choosing this victory path will have consequences in later missions!)[/firecol][br/][br/]Sina's Mission Completed: {INT_0}/{INT_1}

Daiyu Jiang revealed to you her past within the New Horizon movement. Led by Emperor Tholian this movement wanted to break the dominion that the Conscientious Omnipresent Regency Engine known as CORE enacted over mankind. You can win this map by bringing Daiyu's mission to an end and reviving Emperor Tholian.[br/][br/][firecol](Warning: Choosing this victory path will have consequences in later missions!)[/firecol][br/][br/]Emperor Tholian Revived: {INT_0}/{INT_1}
